intro: Dubouzetia saxatilis, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky and arid environments. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as cliffs, gravelly soils, and disturbed areas. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems rise from the center of the rosette, bearing yellow composite flowers that attract pollinators. Dubouzetia saxatilis is adapted to withstand harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
